description.value: 15-item neurologic examination stroke scale that provides a quantitative measure of stroke-related neurological deficit.

purpose.value: To record the results of the National Institutes of Health Stroke Score as a quantitative measurement of stroke-related neurologic deficit.

definition.value: 15-item neurologic examination stroke scale that provides a quantitative measure of stroke-related neurological deficit.
@ internal @
Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms.
@ internal @
Baseline assessment.
@ internal @
Observed level of consciousness of the patient.
Observed level of consciousness of the patient.
The patient is asked the month and his/her age.
The patient is asked the month and his/her age.
The patient is asked to open and close the eyes and then to grip and release the non-paretic hand.
The patient is asked to open and close the eyes and then to grip and release the non-paretic hand.

Observation of limb ataxia as evidence of a unilateral cerebellar lesion.
Only in the case of amputation or joint fusion, the examiner should record the score as untestable (UN)and record the reason in the 'Reason limb ataxia untestable' data element.
